results.title: Burnout
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell, John McDonald and M T I Teleprograms
results.brief_description: A series of dramatized sequences illustrate different types of ‘burnout’ that occur in work situations. Shows the frustrations which create it, varying responses and shows how communication combats burnout. Includes cameos from actor Pee Wee Herman as a therapist, pop star and french film actor.

results.title: Burn, bury or what?
results.brief_description: Describes how the District of Columbia solved its problem of solid waste disposal by developing a technically sound long-range plan. Illustrates how other cities can solve solid waste disposal problems by using sanitary landfill, accomplished through the use of the latest engineering techniques.

results.title: Burn emergency
results.creator_credit: Rick Wise, Sheldon Renan, Pyramid Films and Renan Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the most current methods of caring for burn victims, including thermal, inhalation, electrical and chemical burns, until they can reach a hospital. Demonstrates how to estimate the extent of burn damage and how to take an accident and medical history quickly to facilitate later treatment. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.

results.title: Burn care: a life at stake
results.creator_credit: John Ralmon and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Aimed at teaching first aid for burns. Shows how to assess the extent and degree of burns, and how to treat thermal, electrical and chemical burns before medical aid is administered. Includes interviews with burn victims, medical photographs illustrating various kinds of burns and realistic dramatisations of burn accidents.

results.title: Burma: people of the river
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The varied regions and ways of living in Burma - the rivers that serve as highways; the rice fields in the delta and river valleys; jungle that yields harvests of teakwood and bamboo; the village life; and the city of Rangoon, centre of commerce, transportation and ancient culture.

results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: Roy Boulting, David Macdonald and Army Film Unit
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.

results.title: Burma Railway
results.brief_description: A documentary covering the imprisonment of the ill-fated Australian 8th Division after the fall of Singapore in 1942, and the construction by the prisoners of war of the Burma Railway.

results.title: Burke's Backyard How to Create a Beaut Backyard
results.brief_description: Features selections from the best of “Burke’s Backyard” segments and looks at the basics of creating your own Shangrila. Designed for the whole family, the video takes the viewer through the tips and hints you need to know to create your own private paradise.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Coal Utilization Council and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of the British coal industry covering: the geological formation of coal; the layout and ventilation of a modern mine; the work of individual coal miners; the organization of the various shifts throughout the day; methods employed to extract coal from the coal face; cleaning, grading and transport of coal at the pit-head. “Supervised by the Coal Utilization Council in association with John Grierson and Arthur Elton”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Carter, Coal Utilization Council and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Buried country
results.creator_credit: Andy Nehl, Liz Watts, SBS Independent and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the history of Aboriginal country music over six decades, revealing how Aboriginal Australians have long been inspired by country music and have used it to tell their stories - of everyday life, the connection to the land, the fight for land rights and the struggle for equality. It combines rare archival images and recordings, interviews with musicians, including Jimmy Little, Harry and Wilga Williams, Bob Randall, Roger Knox, Bobby McLeod, Vic Simms, Auriel Andrew, Lionel Rose, Herbie Laughton, Galarrwuy Yunupingu and Troy Cassar-Daley, who speak about the challenges of performing, the discrimination they have faced and the support they have received. The film is both a celebration of the rich tradition of Aboriginal country music and a moving record of indigenous Australia. Based on the book of the same name by Clinton Walker. For further information about the film and related material visit http://buriedcountry.com
